revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=October 2012}} {{Infobox person | image = | caption = Rob Little at a photo shoot | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1972|12|24|38}} | birth_place = [[Pinconning, Michigan]], U.S. | birth_name = Robert Little | other_names = | residence = Los Angeles | occupation = Comedian | years_active = 1998–present | spouse = | children = | parents = | website = }}
'''Rob Little''' (born December 24, 1972) is an American comedian and actor from [[Pinconning, Michigan]]. He has been performing stand-up comedy since 1998 and has been acting in movies and television. He has also produced two straight to DVD comedy specials based on his stand-up. His humor is often self-deprecating, although he prides himself as the "happiest comic in America."<ref name="Matt">{{cite web | last = Libery | first = John | title = Comedian Rob Little to bring laughs to downtown Kalamazoo's Block Party | publisher = Kalamazoo Gazette | date = May 19, 2011 | url = http://www.mlive.com/entertainment/kalamazoo/index.ssf/2011/05/comedian_rob_little_to_bring_l.html | accessdate = December 4, 2012}}</ref>
==Early life== Growing up, Little had a difficult time in elementary school due to being overweight. In an interview, Little stated, "In elementary school, kids would always pull food away from me at lunchtime saying mean, hurtful things like... 'Let go of my sandwich!'".<ref name="Moine">{{cite web |title = Funny Bone: Rob Little |publisher = Symfonee Corporation |url = http://www.symfonee.com/funnybone/desmoines/comedians/Bio.aspx?Uid=d282d776-bd06-4383-9537-96cc8b940cf0 |accessdate = December 4, 2011 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20120405123212/http://www.symfonee.com/funnybone/desmoines/comedians/Bio.aspx?Uid=d282d776-bd06-4383-9537-96cc8b940cf0 |archivedate = April 5, 2012 |df = mdy-all }}</ref> Already at a young age, Little knew he wanted to become a comedian. When Little was 5 years old, he was watching his current inspiration, comedian [[George Carlin]], do a comedy bit on TV when he and his parents were heading to [[Mackinac Island]] for a family vacation. Because his parents were asleep, he was able to view this adult-oriented comedy. Little looked back on that experience and thought to himself, "That's [comedy is] what I want to do the rest of my life."<ref name="Oakland">{{cite web | last = Losinski | first = Brendan | title = Hometown comedian Rob Little returns to the Comedy Castle with good-natured fun | publisher = The Oakland Press | date = November 10, 2011 | url = http://www.theoaklandpress.com/articles/2011/11/10/entertainment/doc4ebbed67ac2cb368793951.txt | accessdate = December 3, 2011}}</ref>
==Education== Little went to [[Central Michigan University]] in [[Mount Pleasant, Michigan]] where he earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration majoring in M.I.S. ([[Management Information Systems]]). He also has an associate's degree in Data Processing from [[Delta College (Michigan)|Delta College]] in [[Bay City, Michigan]].<ref name="Oakland" />
==Career==
===Before Comedy=== After graduating with a degree in business and information sciences, Little has had several jobs. Before comedy, he worked for [[General Motors]] in Detroit, [[Kmart]] in [[Troy, Michigan]], and [[IBM]] in [[Dearborn, Michigan]]. At IBM, Little was a computer programmer. Though this position was lucrative, Rob stated that it was not for him. He was fired from IBM due to an all-company email that he sent which read, "If you aren't happy here, quit your job and follow your dream." Little viewed this as a blessing in disguise because it was after this moment in 1998 that he started becoming a relevant player in the world of comedy.<ref>{{cite web |title = Kansas City Improv: Rob Little Biography |publisher = Symfonee Corporation |url = http://www.symfonee.com/improv/kansascity/comedians/Bio.aspx?Uid=916e9f93-1f8f-45e5-80b6-3e3ed8936242 |accessdate = December 3, 2011 }}{{dead link|date=April 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
===Stand-up and Acting===
Little uses his training from the world famous [[The Second City|Second City Comedy Club]] to create routines that are inventive, funny, spontaneous, and completely unique. He is well known in comedy clubs in Los Angeles and throughout the United States. He is a regular sketch comedy artist on ''[[The Best Damn Sports Show Period]]'' and has made appearances on other shows such as ''[[Last Call with Carson Daly]]'', ''[[Strictly Sex with Dr. Drew]]'' and won $25,000 on [[CBS]]'s ''[[Fire Me...Please]]''.<ref name="Moine" />
He has also appeared in many commercials, such as for [[Snickers]]<ref>{{cite web | title = Snicker's Commercial | publisher = Bear Mythology | url = http://bearmythology.net/2008/06/13/rob-little-snickers-commercial/ | accessdate = December 4, 2011 }}</ref> and [[Chemistry.com]].<ref name="Raj">{{cite web | title = Rob Little: Comedy Television Star | publisher = Corporate Funny | url = http://www.corporatefunny.com/Last-Comic-Standing.html | accessdate = December 4, 2011 }}</ref> As of November 2011, Little is being featured on [[Comedy Central]]’s original series [[Nick Swardson's Pretend Time]] as well as "Who Wants to Date a Comedian?."<ref name="Oakland" /> Also, he has been working on two new projects: one being a follow up to his 2006 comedy special, Haulin’ Ass, which is due to release in 2012, and the other being a new television program he created. This program is called "Here’s a Little History with Rob Little." It features Little traveling to various historical sites around the United States and combines the history of these sites with his comedy. The program is currently being bid on by [[History (U.S. TV channel)|The History Channel]], [[The Travel Channel]], [[Discovery Channel]], [[TLC (TV channel)|TLC]], [[National Geographic Channel]] and [[PBS]]. The pilot for the show was shot in the Detroit area and featured [[The Henry Ford Museum]] and [[Motown Records]]<ref name="Oakland" />
===Mention=== Once described to as "a Bald [[Chris Farley]] with a smack of [[Jack Black]]," Rob responded "I don't mind being bald, look at all the money I save... by not going on dates."<ref>{{cite web | title = Comedian: Rob Little | publisher = Rooftop Media | url = http://www.rooftopcomedy.com/comics/RobLittle | accessdate = December 3, 2011 }}</ref> Rob Little has established himself as one of the funniest, most progressive, new comedians in the country.<ref name="Little">{{cite web | title = Official Website of Rob Little: My Biography | url = http://roblittle.com/ | accessdate = December 3, 2011 }}</ref> Little states on his website that entertainment bookers call him “The Future of comedy with more contagious energy than the Energizer Bunny.”<ref name="Little" /> The [[Detroit Free Press]] selected Little as Michigan’s “Best up and Coming Comedian."<ref name="Little" /> He has been a finalist in both the [[Seattle]] and [[San Francisco International Comedy Competition]].<ref name="Raj" /> He was also selected as a feature performer at the [[Chicago Sketch Fest|Chicago Comedy Festival]] along with the Boston Comedy and Movie Festival.<ref name="Raj" /> [[Maxim (magazine)|Maxim]] magazine awarded him the title "Real Man of Comedy of 2007."<ref name="Matt" /> [[Last Comic Standing]] (on which he’s appeared, but wasn’t competing) tagged Little the "happiest comedian in America." He doesn't call himself that, but wouldn't argue with it.<ref name="Matt" />
===DVD Releases===
====Born: 20 Inches Long==== Born: 20 Inches Long is Little's first independent released DVD featuring comedy recorded live from Joey's Comedy Club in [[Livonia, Michigan]]. It is roughly 40 minutes long and was also released in CD format.<ref>{{cite web | title = Rob Little Born: 20 Inches Long | publisher = The Serious Comedy Site | url = http://www.theseriouscomedysite.com/showreview.php?r_id=113 | accessdate = December 4, 2012}}</ref>
====Rob Little Haulin' Ass==== Little's second independent released DVD, called Haulin' Ass, was released in 2006. The DVD features one of Little's comedy shows recorded live at JD's Comedy Café in [[Milwaukee, Wisconsin]]. It is roughly 55 minutes and was also released in CD format.<ref>{{cite web | title = Rob Little Haulin' Ass | publisher = The Serious Comedy Site | url = http://www.theseriouscomedysite.com/showreview.php?r_id=1203 | accessdate = December 4, 2012}}</ref>
Both Born: 20 Inches Long and Haulin' Ass can be purchased straight off of Rob Little's official website.<ref name="Little" />
==References== <references />
==External links== * [http://www.roblittle.com Rob Little's Official Website] * [http://www.facebook.com/roblittlefans Rob Little on Facebook] * [https://twitter.com/roblittlecomic Rob Little on Twitter] * [https://www.youtube.com/robthecomic11 Rob Little's YouTube Channel] * {{IMDb name|id=1732003|name=Rob Little}}
{{authority control}}
